attributes.action: Hold MPs strictly accountable to the Code of Conduct for Members of Parliament
attributes.additional_details: This is an unacceptable double standard. MPs as leaders of the country have a responsibility as role models to all, but particularly to young adults and children who see this behaviour in the media. MPs transgressions, and the sanctions imposed upon them should be made public as their voting records are. Then, voters can be reassured of the integrity of the system, and can decide if the person standing for election has the integrity, moral fibre and character worthy of their vote.
attributes.background: The behaviour of some MPs is a national and international disgrace. There appears to be no real consequence for MPs who transgress with illegal, discriminatory, fraudulent, abusive, dishonest or socially unacceptable behaviour, which would result in convictions for ordinary members of the public.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We're not sure exactly what behaviour you're concerned about or how you want MPs to be held "strictly accountable".

The current Code of Conduct is available here:

https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm/cmcode.htm

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

You might like to sign this petition, if it calls for something you'd like to happen:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/270648
